movies.title: Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie
movies.plot: 1940: During the chaotic running fights of the French army the 7th company disappears - nobody knows they've been taken captive. Only their scouting patrol, three witty but lazy guys, can escape and now wanders around behind the German lines. They'd like to just stay out the fights, but a Lieutenant urges them to use a captured truck to break through to their troops.
movies.simplePlot: 1940: During the chaotic running fights of the French army the 7th company disappears - nobody knows they've been taken captive. Only their scouting patrol, three witty but lazy guys, can ...

biography.bio: Jean Lefebvre was born on October 3, 1919 in Valenciennes, Nord, France as Jean Marcel Lefebvre. He was an actor, known for Diabolique (1955), Le gendarme se marie (1968) and The Troops on Vacation (1970). He was married to Brigitte Lerebours, Yori Bertin and Micheline Grasser. He died on July 9, 2004 in Marrakech, Morocco.
biography.name: Jean Lefebvre

biography.bio: Pierre Mondy was born on February 10, 1925 in Neuilly-sur-Seine, Seine [now Hauts-de-Seine], France as Pierre Cuq. He is known for his work on Les Cordier, juge et flic (1992), Astérix et la surprise de César (1985) and Astérix chez les Bretons (1986). He was married to Catherine Allary, Anne Fournier, Pascale Roberts and Claude Gensac. He died on September 15, 2012 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Pierre Mondy

biography.bio: Aldo Maccione was born on November 27, 1935 in Turin, Italy. He is an actor, known for La leggenda di Al, John e Jack (2002), Perdiamoci di vista (1994) and The Chambermaid on the Titanic (1997).
biography.name: Aldo Maccione

biography.bio: Robert Lamoureux was born on January 4, 1920 in Paris, France. He was an actor and writer, known for Impossible... pas français (1974), Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973) and On a retrouvé la 7ème Compagnie! (1975). He was married to Magali Vendeuil and Simone Chailneau. He died on October 29, 2011 in Boulogne-Billancourt, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Robert Lamoureux

biography.bio: Pierre Tornade began his film career playing his first role in Lock Up Your Spoons (1957). He then had supporting roles in many famous French films like The Troops in New York (1965) and The Restaurant (1966), both featuring Louis de Funès, I Don't Know Much, But I'll Say Everything (1973) directed by Pierre Richard and also featuring him, and Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973). Pierre Tornade is mostly well known for voicing several characters in many animated films and series. These include Vitalstatistix in Asterix films Asterix the Gaul (1967), Asterix and Cleopatra (1968) and The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976), Obelix in Astérix et la surprise de César (1985), Astérix chez les Bretons (1986), Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989) and Asterix in America (1994), and Averell Dalton in Lucky Luke films Lucky Luke (1971), Lucky Luke: Ballad of the Daltons (1978) and Les Dalton en cavale (1983).
biography.name: Pierre Tornade

biography.bio: Short, stocky Jacques Marin was a wonderfully droll character actor, who tended to pop up in international films of the 60's and 70's, whenever a typically French-looking gendarme, police inspector, concierge or shopkeeper was needed. His trademark was a toothbrush moustache and a deadpan expression -- except for a perpetually reproving frown -- which suggested deeper thought processes were going on. Despite all his overt seriousness, his characters were usually amusing, or, at least, likeable. A fluent English-speaker, he effortlessly alternated between French and English-language productions, beginning with The Vintage (1957). He is also fondly remembered as the ineffectual Inspector Grandpierre in Charade (1963), as Major Duvalle in Darling Lili (1970), and as Massenet, one of the potential culinary victims in Ted Kotcheff's black comedy Who Is Killing the Great Chefs of Europe? (1978). While the majority of Marin's prolific career consisted of little more than small supporting roles and cameos, his was one of the faces you'd remember at the end of the film. Marin had studied acting at the Conservatoire national superieur d'art dramatique de Paris and made his feature debut in the war drama Forbidden Games (1952). He often appeared alongside Jean Gabin and was a frequent performer on stage at the Theatre Marigny and the Celestins Theatre in Lyon. Over the decades, he provided many a memorable moment in French film, including in Youthful Sinners (1958), Love Is My Profession (1958), Fantômas se déchaîne (1965) and in Trois hommes sur un cheval (1969).
biography.name: Jacques Marin

biography.bio: Marcelle Ranson-Hervé was born on October 10, 1929 in Marseille, Bouches-du-Rhône, Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur, France as Marcelle Antoinette Rancon. She is an actress, known for Crésus (1960), Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973) and Deux coeurs simples (1972).
biography.name: Marcelle Ranson-Hervé

biography.bio: Erik Colin is an actor, known for Rendez-moi ma peau... (1980), Le provocateur (1973) and Ne le dites pas avec des roses (1977).
biography.name: Erik Colin

biography.bio: Paul Bisciglia was born on July 30, 1928 in Algiers, Alger, France. He was an actor, known for Astérix chez les Bretons (1986), Before the Deluge (1954) and The Mad Adventures of 'Rabbi' Jacob (1973). He died on April 18, 2010 in Nanterre, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Paul Bisciglia

biography.bio: Robert Dalban was born on July 19, 1903 in Celles-sur-Belle, Deux-Sèvres, France as Gaston Barré. He is known for his work on Diabolique (1955), Fantomas (1964) and Monsieur Gangster (1963). He was married to Madeleine Robinson. He died on April 3, 1987 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Robert Dalban

biography.bio: Alain Doutey was born on October 12, 1944 in Paris, France. He is an actor and producer, known for Frantic (1988), Mesrine Part 2: Public Enemy #1 (2008) and The Big Red One (1980).
biography.name: Alain Doutey

biography.birthName: Magali Uremie Lucinde Pichon de Vendeuil
biography.bio: Magali Vendeuil was born on September 18, 1926 in La Vernarède, Gard, France as Magali Uremie Lucinde Pichon de Vendeuil. She was an actress, known for Beauties of the Night (1952), Plus de whisky pour Callaghan! (1955) and Double Verdict (1961). She was married to Robert Lamoureux. She died on January 12, 2009 in Neuilly-sur-Seine, Hauts-de-Seine, France.
biography.name: Magali Vendeuil

biography.bio: Konrad von Bork is an actor, known for La 7ème compagnie au clair de lune (1977), Mado (1976) and Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973).
biography.name: Konrad von Bork

biography.bio: Corinne Lahaye was born on March 28, 1947 in Bois-Colombes, Hauts-de-Seine, France. She is an actress, known for Sexuella (1976), On n'est pas sorti de l'auberge (1982) and Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973). She was previously married to Jean-Pierre Darras.
biography.name: Corinne Lahaye

biography.bio: François Merlet is an actor and director, known for Glamour (1985), Mais où est donc passée la 7ème compagnie (1973) and Commissaire Moulin (1976).
biography.name: François Merlet
